blog.name: suchaskam
blog.title: Such a Skam
blog.description: Nes | 21 | Left Handed | Leo | believes in light and dark, lives in purple and yellow | I have a sideblog for my non existent writing: such-a-fanfiction, go follow me on there people

summary: Wait, there aren’t canteens or cafeterias at schools in Italia? Oh, i find it interesting. I mean, we too have lunch break and...
body:
Wait, there aren’t canteens or cafeterias at schools in Italia? Oh, i find it interesting. I mean, we too have lunch break and all and some students go home, eat their lunch and go back, but we also canteens at schools in Turkey; although cafeterias are rarer.

Care to explain italian fellas? And people from other countries, how’s the system at your schools?

reblog.comment:

Care to explain italian fellas? And people from other countries, how’s the system at your schools?

Care to explain italian fellas? And people from other countries, how’s the system at your schools?
trail.content:

Care to explain italian fellas? And people from other countries, how’s the system at your schools?

blog.name: sivis2016
blog.title: Not Really A Blog
blog.description: Just some thoughts

tags: every story is unique and important
but not BETTER than the original
summary:
Okey I just have to say something. 
Just because you relate to a remake and some characters more than you did with Skam, it...
body:
Okey I just have to say something.

Just because you relate to a remake and some characters more than you did with Skam, it still doesn’t make the remake better than the original.

I actually cringe a little every time I see people saying that.

Julie Andem chose to tell the stories of those four teens we all know and love so much. They certainly doesn’t represent all of the teens in Norway, but the issues they’re dealing with is very much recognizable for people pretty much all over the world. Issues with low self esteem, eating disorders, homophobia, loneliness, mental health issues, love, heartbreak, friendship. This is all universal topics.

Isak’s story is just ONE story and he is not representing all gay teens in Norway, but his story is still very much important for the lgbt community, not only in Norway, but all around the world.

So will Martino’s story be better than Isak’s? No, cause that’s not possible. But sure, it can be more relatable to a lot of people. That’s a huge difference. Please remember that.

Skam was created to help Norwegian teenagers deal with real life issues. To make them feel less alone.

That should always be the most important thing in every Skam remake too. It’s not about telling a ‘better story’ or make the characters do or say less shitty things. That’s not the real life of teenagers, that’s just the glossy tv version. And Skam was never that bitch.
